history.content:
Fairly late answer so hope you figured it out already, but I'm someone who just accepted an offer for a Spring internship. My EECS academic advisor said that it's very common and everything should go through smoothly. My advisor also said you're guaranteed a full 8 semesters at Berkeley so you can extend graduation by one semester if you do take an internship next semester.

From what my advisor told me:

Submit withdrawal request on CalCentral before start of instruction to avoid fees, Notify Financial Aid office about your withdrawal. Wait until request is approved. Email your academic advisor with reason/internship offer letter. For readmission, readmission form and statement of legal residence. My advisor also noted that readmission stuff should be done by mid-march if you're returning Fall semester so that you can enroll in classes and everything on time.

I want to take an offer for a Spring internship. I am a sophomore (EECS) and I am in good academic standing. I have read that in the Engineering department, to withdraw, I just need to talk with my academic adviser and send them my offer letter. My academic adviser is out until 1/6, should I be worried that my withdrawal/ readmission won't go through?
history.subject: Spring Internship
